p: PD and DLB’s common feature is an abnormal accumulation of aggregated misfolded α-synuclein in proteinaceous neuronal inclusions named Lewy bodies ( Figure 1B, C) and Lewy neurites [ 2, 3, 4, 5]. In MSA, α-synuclein inclusions accumulated mostly within oligodendrocytes are called glial cytoplasmic inclusions (GCI) ( Figure 1D) [ 6].
